text: The second point is that we need better benchmarks for real-world usage. Current benchmarks test narrow skills but miss how people actually use these tools. (2/4)
Third, the cost of inference is dropping faster than anyone predicted. What cost $10 in compute 6 months ago now costs $0.50. This changes what's economically viable. (3/4)
Finally, I think the biggest unlock is in agents that can reliably use tools. We're not there yet, but we're close. The gap between demo and production is shrinking fast. (4/4) /end
